content:
Do you really mean you over 800 FOLDERS in your Sent folder - 'cause that would be very unusual and might indicate that there's something wrong - or do you mean you have over 800 MESSAGES in your Sent folder? And are you OK with losing all those messages forever?

If so, simply select them all (click on one, then press CTRL+A to select all) and then press the Delete key. They will then go into your Trash folder. You can then right-click on the Trash folder and choose Empty Trash.

If this is not what you're trying to do, please clarify and give us more details.

By the way, the Unified Folders feature will show all similar folders for multiple email accounts as one virtual folder. For example, all Inbox messages together, all Trash folders together, etc. Some people (not me) find this to be a cleaner presentation. But it's not necessary to use the feature to delete messages.

content:
This is how to adjust the fonts for viewing and composing messages:

- go to TB menu > Settings > General > Language & Fonts > Fonts > click 'Advanced' button

- at the top, set 'Fonts for:' to Latin if it isn't already

- change Proportional and Monospace fonts/sizes to your liking

- set Minimum font size to 14

- at the top, change set 'Fonts for:' to Other Writing Systems

- repeat the process of changing fonts/sizes

- at the bottom, make sure 'Allow messages to use other fonts' is disabled if desired > OK > close the popup
creator: siffemoz

content:
1. Choose Tools > Developer Tools > Error Console
  2. Paste the expression: 
  openDialog("chrome://pippki/content/resetpassword.xhtml")
  1. then, press the Evaluate button. That will open a dialog asking you if you want to reset your password. If Evaluate is not seen, press enter key.
  2. When prompted, press the Reset button.

This removes all account passwords.

content:
account IMAP o POP3?

più in generale, Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: You need to train the filter by marking false positives as 'Not Spam'. See https://support.mozilla.org/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages
creator: christ1

content: No, you can't. Thunderbird is an email program that runs on your local computer and interacts with external email services like Gmail, Comcast, AOL, Plusnet, or (resumably) Greenby . Thunderbird doesn't offer email hosting services. So, you'll have to find another email host on your own. Once you do that, you will almost certainly be able to use Thunderbird to manage the email on that account.
creator: rednoise

content: The Unified Folders feature is display only, that is, it doesn't actually move any emails anywhere, it just shows them all in the same place. You can turn it off and on at will from the menu option View | Folders | Unified Folders.
creator: rednoise

content: If I understand your question, you are now viewing your messages list in Cards View but you prefer to see it in Table View. You can switch between views at will by clicking on the little icon to the right of the top of the Messages list and choosing Table View. See the attached image.

content: A .vcs file is a legacy calendar format officially known as a vCalendar file. While it has largely been superseded by the more modern .ics (iCalendar) format, it is still used by older software and some mobile devices to exchange scheduling information. Modern versions of Thunderbird only support the .ics (iCalendar) format for importing events. The .vcs (vCalendar 1.0) format is considered obsolete, and direct support for it has been removed.
creator: christ1
